data.title: Emmet: svg abbreviations dont work

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
**Update**: We can now support svg abbreviations but only after mapping the current language mode to "svg" in `emmet.syntaxProfiles` setting.

We should investigate having `svg` as an embedded language like we do for `html` inside `jsx`

Testing #11139
- VSCode Version: 1.5.0- Insiders (dated 8/31)
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Create `svg` file. Type `gl` and hit `TAB`

As per the abbreviations in [lib/snippets.json#L892](https://github.com/emmetio/emmet/blob/master/lib/snippets.json#L892), `gl` should have expanded to `<glyph>`
Instead, it expands to `<gl></gl>`

Same result with other abbreviations for `svg`

Similarly, if you associate any language with `svg` syntax profile, you cannot get any abbreviations expansion.

data.title: Use a configuration object when creating terminals via API
data.body:
In order to avoid issues with parameter order and addition options in the future, factor out the terminal configuration and use that in `window.createTerminal` (similar to the config object used in `setLanguageConfiguration`).

Old: `createTerminal(name?: string): Terminal`
New: `createTerminal(configuration: TerminalConfiguration): Terminal`

FYI @jrieken

data.title: Indented code blocks in Hovers should use the correct language for the hover provider
Syntax highlight large files
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.4.0
- OS Version: Windows 10 Pro

Steps to Reproduce:
1. open a file with over 5000 lines of code

As soon as line 4790 from a file (I've seen it with javascript files) is reached, the syntax highlighting suddenly stops.

data.title: Emmet: Provide Intellisense for emmet settings that use a language Id
data.body:
Testing #11139
- VSCode Version: 1.5.0-insiders (dated 8/31)
- OS Version: Windows

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Associate `js` with `html` syntax profile in user settings

``` json
{
    "emmet.syntaxProfiles": {
        "js": "html"
    }
}
```
1. Open a .js file and try to use any of the `html` abbreviations 

Observe that the abbreviations do not work

data.title: remote php.validate.executablePath
data.body:
Today everyone is using virtual environments. In my case, i need to maintain a mass of microservices which got diffrent configurations. Espacialy the php version in combination with diffrent extensions.

Therefore i would like to execute the php, which is located on the virtual machine! To make that happen i need the ability to configurate that.

data.title: Correct docs for Hover.range
data.body: Hover items without a range set are ignored.

data.title: Typo in closeOnFocusLost setting comment
data.body:
- VSCode Version:1.5.0
- OS Version:Windows 10

// Controls if quick open should close automatically once it looses focus.
"workbench.quickOpen.closeOnFocusLost": true,

looses -> loses
Nit: quick open -> Quick Open

Should be:
// Controls if Quick Open should close automatically once it loses focus.

data.title: Terminal.show does not preserve focus
Launching from command line disables ability to launch from shell

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.4.0 (6276dcb0ae497766056b4c09ea75be1d76a8b679, 2016-08-04T16:45:31.680Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.14393

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Right click in any Windows Explorer window and Open in Code. It works.
2. Close Code.
3. Now run `code .` from any directory at the command line. VS Code will launch.
4. Now try step 1 again and Code will no longer launch. Same behavior for launching either files or folders or opening any files with Code as associated handler.

cc: @danielegan

data.title: Find match color is hardcoded at multiple places
data.body:
Search view and References widget re-uses the find match color `rgba(234, 92, 0, 0.3)` by hardcoding. After exporting the find match color as TM theme setting, these should also start using the color value from the setting.

Verification steps:
- Clone the repository [VS Code Extension Samples](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode-extension-samples)
- Open VS Code on **theme-sample**
- Open **Sample_Dark.tmTheme** and **Sample_Light.tmTheme** files and change the color for the setting **findMatchHighlight**
- Run the extension using Launch Extension. 

Verify the above color is picked by
- Find matches

![screen shot 2016-09-01 at 10 57 11](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10746682/18161650/190d5788-7033-11e6-80f9-b53df4292ab5.png)
- Search matches

![screen shot 2016-09-01 at 10 57 52](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10746682/18161654/1e9e68b8-7033-11e6-8478-6ce7a33607bd.png)
- Reference matches

![screen shot 2016-09-01 at 10 58 44](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10746682/18161659/23096678-7033-11e6-846b-bfa3c7308246.png)

data.title: Highlight the line for current search result
data.body: Find widget highlights the line for current find match. Allow the same behavior of Search.

data.title: Stale image preview when updating an image file
data.body:
- VSCode Version:1.4.0
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open a project folder in VSCode
2. Copy an image named test.png into that folder.
3. Overwrite the test.png image with another image of the same name (via drag and drop, or outside of VSCode)
4. Observe that the image preview shows the old image, even after pressing refresh

A restart of VSCode shows the new image.

I tripped over this twice already and it is extremely confusing when pulling changes from git and still seeing the old version.

data.title: Can't do anything meaningful with Go build tasks
data.body:
- VSCode Version:
  1.4.0, Luke Hoban's Go plugin
- OS Version:
  OS X El Capitan, macOS Sierra beta <any build>.

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Desire building a Go program without debug code.
2.Marvel at how this simple command is seemingly impossible to enter:
go build -ldflags "-w"

This fails at the quotes, and it doesn't accept escaping with \" at all. Build tasks need to be more flexible in that respect.

data.title: Open external terminal launch/debug with correct Terminal
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.4.0
- OS Version: OS X El Capitan 10.11.5

When debugging/launching your code, VSC doesn't use your external terminal preference set in `settings.json`. I think it should be global, or at the very least, another option to be able to change for that specific type of action.
#### Steps to Reproduce:
1. In your `settings.json`, set your terminal to a different one. e.g. for OSX, use:
   
   ```
   // Customizes which terminal application to run on OS X.
   "terminal.external.osxExec": "iTerm.app"
   ```
2. In `launch.json`, set an action with `"externalConsole": true`
3. Start debugging/running your application
4. Your application will run in the default `Terminal.app` (or your OS equivalent)
#### Expected behavior:

Last step should respect your preferences

data.title: Support or allow customizing of common custom terminal keybindings

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.4.0
- OS Version: 10.11.6 mac os x

Steps to Reproduce:
1. type in a word/command into vs code terminal
2. hold option key and tap delete key

Deleting a whole word while holding option "meta" key does not work. One character is deleted. In the regular terminal for os x in preferences there is a checkbox that lets you enable the option key to be used as a meta key which allows holding the option key and hitting delete to delete an entire word at a time.

data.title: Add latex support to markdown rendering
data.body:
Adds support for latex rendering in the markdown plugin and preview window. This PR implements this via `markdown-it-katex`

Resolves: https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/6529

(This is my first PR for vscode so feedback is extremely welcome)

data.title: Correct docs for IEditorScrollbarOptions.useShadows
Message service show action buttons in reverse order
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5

Steps:
- show a message with actions.

Observe: the actions appear in reverse order in which they are provided. We should respect the order in which the actions are passed into the function.

data.title: Simplify API for working with editors after they were opened

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Today it is hard to work with opened editors because for each you need to know position and input. It would be nicer if opening an editor returns a (stable - even across moves) reference that can be used to work on the editor (e.g. close, move, pin).

Alternatively we could think about returning a rich object from the openEditor() call that methods can be called on (editor.close(), editor.move() etc.).

data.title: IntelliSense stops working when renaming a file and creating a new one with the same name
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.4.0
- OS Version: Windows 10 Pro

Steps to Reproduce:
1.  Have a working IntelliSense for TypeScript files in the project.
2.  Rename a file you're currently working in that has working IntelliSense. (from app.ts to app1.ts)
3.  Create a new file with the same original name as the file you renamed. (app.ts)
4.  You no longer have working IntelliSense in the new file (app.ts).
